title: Passage's belief in Japanese imperialist policies

content.question: Ideas similar to those expressed in the passage would contribute most directly to which of the following?

choices.label: Japanese imperialist policies in East and Southeast Asia in the first half of the twentieth century
Japanese government attempts to mobilize public opinion by promoting the veneration of the emperor in the 1930s and 1940s
Japan’s policy of demilitarization after the end of the Second World War

content.answer: Japanese imperialist policies in East and Southeast Asia in the first half of the twentieth century

topic.text: 7.5: Unresolved Tensions after World War I

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Explain the significance of a source's point of view, purpose, historical situation, and/or audience, including how these might limit the use(s) of a source.
